item.title: Notes on a lateral career move
item.description: I changed jobs recently. That's not all that uncommon for devs - in fact it's accepted wisdom that your best course of action is to switch every 2 years or so in order to maximise your salary. That may or may not be true, but it's not really the route I've taken. item.title: Rolling your own crypto: Everything you need to build AES from scratch (and then never use it for anything of consequence)
item.description: You often hear the phrase "Don't roll your own crypto". I think this sentence is missing an important qualifier: "...and then use it for anything of consequence". If you are building a product or service, or are trying to communicate privately, then you should absolutely pick a vetted, open source, off-the-shelf implementation and use it.
